full_summary:
**Request for Proposal: Genotyping Swine Tissue Samples**

**Project Overview:**
Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) is seeking a Canadian laboratory to provide genotyping analysis services using swine-specific low-pass skim sequencing for the Lacombe Research and Development Centre. The successful bidder will be required to analyze up to 2,000 swine samples per year for three years as part of two studies focused on genetic selection of pigs based on quality traits and slaughter weight.

**Contract Period:**
The anticipated start date is December 2024, and the contract will run for approximately three years from the date of award.

**Mandatory Technical Requirements:**
The bidder must meet the following technical requirements:

* Genotyping analysis using swine-specific low-pass skim sequencing
* Analysis of up to 2,000 swine samples per year for three years
* Compliance with all relevant health and safety regulations
*Submission of bi-annual progress reports

**Tender Requirements:**
* Bidders must submit their proposals electronically using the CPC Connect service provided by Canada Post Corporation
* Proposals must be submitted to the AAFC Bid Receiving Unit by the specified deadline
* All documents must be submitted in English or French

**Selection Criteria:**
* Proposals will be evaluated based on technical and financial evaluation criteria
* The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award of a contract

**Submitting a Proposal:**
* To submit a proposal, please visit the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/solicitation-opportunities](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/solicitation-opportunities)
* Proposals must be submitted by the specified deadline to be considered
